biography.bio: Ornella Muti was born on March 9, 1955 in Rome, Lazio, Italy as Francesca Romana Rivelli. She is an actress, known for Flash Gordon (1980), Conte de la folie ordinaire (1981) and Trilogy: Two (2002). She was previously married to Federico Fachinetti and Alessio Orano.
biography.name: Ornella Muti

biography.bio: Handsome, rugged, and talented Italian-American actor Tony Musante was born on June 30, 1936 in Bridgeport, Connecticut to an accountant father and a school teacher mother. He attended both Northwestern University and Oberlin College. Tony worked as a school teacher prior to beginning his acting career in Off-Broadway theater in 1960. In 1962 Musante married his writer wife Jane Sparkes. He made his film debut in 1965 in "Once a Thief." Musante gave a chillingly believable and electrifying portrayal of nasty punk hoodlum Joe Ferrone in the harsh and hard-hitting "The Incident," a role which he had previously played in the hour long made-for-TV drama "Ride With Terror." Tony won a best actor award at the Mar del Plata Film Festival for his outstanding performance in "The Incident." Musante went on to act in a handful of features made in Italy; he was especially memorable as brash Mexican revolutionary Paco Roman in the superior spaghetti Western "The Mercenary" and as imperiled American writer Sam Dalmas in Dario Argento's masterful giallo murder mystery thriller "The Bird With the Crystal Plumage." In addition, Tony played more than his fair share of Mafiosa types: He was genuinely frightening as vicious hit man Paul Rickard in "The Last Run;" spot-on as smooth heel Eddie Hagan in Robert Aldrich's supremely gritty "The Grissom Gang;" excellent as Eric Roberts' mob-connected Uncle Pete in "The Pope of Greenwich Village;" and once again splendid as shrewd mob capo Nino Schibetta on the gritty cable TV prison drama "Oz." Musante had a starring role as real life chameleon-like New Jersey cop Dave Toma on the short-lived TV series "Toma." After Tony left the show due to creative differences with the producers, the program was changed to "Baretta" with Robert Blake in the lead. Among the TV shows Musante had guest spots on are "The Alfred Hitchcock Hour," "The Fugitive," "Marcus Welby, M.D.," "The Rockford Files," "Medical Story" (Tony was nominated for an Emmy award for his performance in the episode "The Quality of Mercy"), "Police Story," "The Equalizer," "Night Heat," and "Nothing Sacred." Moreover, Tony had a recurring part on the popular daytime soap opera "As The World Turns." On stage Musante appeared in the Broadway productions of "P.S., Your Cat Is Dead!" (Tony was nominated for a Drama Desk Award for his acting in this particular play), "A Memory of Two Mondays/27 Wagons Full of Cotton," and "The Lady from Dubuque." Musante died at age 77 on November 26, 2013 in New York City.
biography.name: Tony Musante

biography.bio: Monica Guerritore was born on January 5, 1958 in Rome, Lazio, Italy. She is an actress, known for La lupa (1996), Tell No One (2012) and The Worst Week of My Life (2011). She has been married to Roberto Zaccaria since August 17, 2010. She was previously married to Gabriele Lavia.
biography.name: Monica Guerritore

biography.bio: Mario Scaccia was born on December 26, 1919 in Rome, Lazio, Italy. He was an actor, known for We Still Kill the Old Way (1967), Between Miracles (1971) and Le Parfum de la Dame en Noir (1974). He died on January 26, 2011 in Rome.
biography.name: Mario Scaccia

biography.bio: Laura Trotter was born on June 9, 1950 in Cles, Trento, Trentino-Alto Adige, Italy. She is an actress, known for Nightmare City (1980), The Warning (1980) and Frivolous Lola (1998).
biography.name: Laura Trotter

biography.bio: Gerardo Amato was born on October 15, 1948 in Ascoli Satriano, Apulia, Italy as Gerardo Placido. He is an actor, known for Passion of Love (1981), I frati rossi (1988) and Angel of Evil (2010).
biography.name: Gerardo Amato

biography.bio: Umberto Benedetto was born in 1915 in Patti, Messina, Sicily, Italy. He was an actor, known for Eutanasia di un amore (1978). He died on March 10, 2003 in Florence, Tuscany, Italy.
biography.name: Umberto Benedetto

biography.bio: Enrico Bergier was born on December 28, 1931 in Buenos Aires, Argentina. He is an assistant director and actor, known for La Grande Bouffe (1973), Death Rides a Horse (1967) and A Bullet for the General (1967).
biography.name: Enrico Bergier

biography.bio: Eduardo Salerno is an actor and assistant director, known for Eutanasia di un amore (1978), Nazi Love Camp 27 (1977) and Calling All Police Cars (1975).
biography.name: Eduardo Salerno

biography.bio: Luciano Fineschi was born on March 26, 1925 in Turin, Italy. He was an actor and composer, known for W le donne (1970), Eutanasia di un amore (1978) and Il suo nome è Donna Rosa (1969). He died on January 18, 2006 in Salerno, Campania, Italy.
biography.name: Luciano Fineschi

biography.bio: Karina Verlier was born as Karine Stämpfli. She is an actress, known for Alessia... un vulcano sotto la pelle (1978), La chambre de l'évèque (1977) and Charlie Bravo (1980).
biography.name: Karina Verlier
